intro: Fedia dasycarpa, commonly known as the dense-fruited fedia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
